gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata Part 2 Extensions for imagery and gridded data

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Office of Coast Survey Wrecks and Obstructions Database

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: View the complete metadata record on InPort for more information about this dataset.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Office of Coast Survey's Wrecks and Obstructions database contains information on the identified submerged wrecks and obstructions within the U.S. maritime boundaries. The data includes the position of each feature (latitude and longitude) along with a brief description. Information to populate the database comes from what is currently available on the electronic navigational chart (ENC) and Coast Survey's Automated Wrecks and Obstructions Information System (AWOIS) database.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The Office of Coast Survey is responsible for charting the Nation's waterways to ensure safe marine transportation and navigation. Hydrographic surveying is a critical component of this process. The AWOIS and charted (Electronic Navigational Charts - ENCs) wrecks and obstructions have been identified over the course of OCS' history and cataloged in a database for use in survey planning and also for inclusion on the nautical chart suite. The database and associated mapping services are provided to the public as a related service for general usage.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Cite As: Office of Coast Survey, [Date of Access]: Office of Coast Survey Wrecks and Obstructions Database [Data Date Range], https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/inport/item/39988.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: NOAA provides no warranty, nor accepts any liability occurring from any incomplete, incorrect, or misleading data, or from any incorrect, incomplete, or misleading use of the data. It is the responsibility of the user to determine whether or not the data is suitable for the intended purpose.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Use Constraints: The database records are not comprehensive. There are wrecks that do not appear on the nautical charts and wrecks on the nautical charts that do not appear in the historical records. Updates to database are limited, with priority given to wrecks that may be hazards to navigation. We have removed reported wrecks that have been salvaged or disproved by further investigation.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA Data Management Plan for this record on InPort.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The data layers in this data set consist of: Automated Wrecks and Obstructions Information System (AWOIS) wreck features and navigational obstruction features, as well as Electronic Naviational Charts (ENC) wreck features. The attribution across each feature type has been standardized to be consistent. Not all attribution will be present for each feature in each layer, due to the differing sources that have been used to populate the database.

Updates to database are limited, with priority given to wrecks that may be hazards to navigation. We have removed reported wrecks that have been salvaged or disproved by further investigation
